tickets.title: Initial Project Setup and Navigation
tickets.description: Set up the React Native project structure, install essential libraries (e.g., navigation, lottie), and configure basic navigation to handle transitions between the Home screen and the future Game screen.
acceptance_criteria: React Native project is initialized and runnable on iOS and Android simulators.
A basic stack navigator is implemented.
A placeholder HomeScreen is defined as the initial route.

tickets.title: Implement HomeScreen UI Layout
tickets.description: Build the static layout for the HomeScreen as per the design spec, including placing the mascot image, title, subtitle, and button container. This ticket focuses on structure, not component logic.
acceptance_criteria: The screen uses a SafeAreaView to avoid notches.
The app mascot, title, and subtitle are displayed in the correct positions.
A container for the game mode selection buttons is present.

tickets.title: Create Reusable PrimaryButton Component
tickets.description: Develop the `PrimaryButton` component with styling and animations defined in the design spec. It should be reusable and accept props for title, icon, and onPress actions.
acceptance_criteria: Component matches the design spec's `code_snippet` for styling (colors, padding, shadow, etc.).
An `Animated.spring` effect scales the button to 0.98 on press for tactile feedback.
The button correctly displays a title and an optional icon.
The `onPress` prop is called when the button is tapped.

tickets.title: Integrate Buttons and Navigation on HomeScreen
tickets.description: Integrate the `PrimaryButton` components into the HomeScreen layout and wire up their `onPress` handlers to navigate to the GameBoardScreen, passing the selected game mode (e.g., 'vs-friend' or 'vs-coach').
acceptance_criteria: HomeScreen displays 'Play vs. Friend' and 'Play vs. Coach' buttons.
Tapping 'Play vs. Friend' navigates to the GameBoardScreen with the two-player mode selected.
Tapping 'Play vs. Coach' navigates to the GameBoardScreen with the single-player mode selected.

milestone: Milestone 2: Core Game Logic & Board UI

tickets.title: Implement GameBoardScreen Layout
tickets.description: Create the basic structure for the GameBoardScreen, including the player turn indicator area and the 3x3 grid container, as per the wireframe.
dependencies: Integrate Buttons and Navigation on HomeScreen
acceptance_criteria: A new screen component, GameBoardScreen, is created and accessible via navigation.
The layout contains placeholders for the PlayerTurnIndicator and the 3x3 game board.
The screen correctly receives the game mode parameter from the HomeScreen.

tickets.title: Create Interactive GameBoardCell Component
tickets.description: Develop the `GameBoardCell` component. This includes styling for empty, 'X', and 'O' states, tap handling, and the 'pop' placement animation.
acceptance_criteria: Cell styling matches the `code_snippet` from the design spec.
The component can display 'X', 'O', or nothing based on a prop.
Placing a marker triggers a satisfying `Animated.spring` scale-up animation.
The `onPress` callback is invoked only when the cell is empty.

tickets.title: Develop Core Tic Tac Toe State Management
tickets.description: Implement the client-side logic to manage the game state. This includes the 3x3 board array, tracking the current player's turn, and handling player moves.
acceptance_criteria: A state variable holds the 3x3 grid's values (null, 'X', or 'O').
A state variable tracks the current turn ('X' or 'O').
Tapping an empty `GameBoardCell` updates the grid state with the current player's marker.
After a move, the turn correctly switches to the other player.

tickets.title: Implement PlayerTurnIndicator Component
tickets.description: Build the `PlayerTurnIndicator` UI that visually highlights the active player. It should smoothly animate transitions between players as defined in the design spec.
dependencies: Develop Core Tic Tac Toe State Management
acceptance_criteria: Component displays both player markers ('X' and 'O').
The active player's marker is scaled up, opaque, and has a background color, while the inactive player is scaled down and semi-transparent.
The transition between active states is smoothly animated using `LayoutAnimation` or a similar library.

tickets.title: Implement Win/Draw Detection Logic
tickets.description: Create the logic to check the game state after each move to determine if a win, loss, or draw condition has been met.
dependencies: Develop Core Tic Tac Toe State Management
acceptance_criteria: The function correctly identifies a winning condition for 'X' or 'O' across all 8 possible lines (3 rows, 3 columns, 2 diagonals).
The function correctly identifies a draw when all cells are filled and there is no winner.
The game state is updated to reflect the outcome (e.g., 'X_WINS', 'DRAW').
Player input is disabled once the game is over.

tickets.title: Implement GameOverModal UI Shell
tickets.description: Build the `GameOverModal` component, including the semi-transparent overlay and the modal container, styled according to the design spec. The modal should appear/disappear based on a `visible` prop.
acceptance_criteria: The modal renders on top of the GameBoardScreen.
It includes a semi-transparent overlay that covers the entire screen.
The modal container styling matches the `code_snippet` (background, border radius, shadow).
The modal's entrance and exit are animated (fade and scale).

tickets.title: Integrate Game Over Logic with Modal
tickets.description: Connect the game's win/draw state to the `GameOverModal`. The modal should automatically appear when the game ends and display the correct result text (e.g., 'You Won!', 'It's a Draw!').
acceptance_criteria: The modal becomes visible when the game state is 'X_WINS', 'O_WINS', or 'DRAW'.
The title text in the modal dynamically changes to reflect the game outcome.
The modal includes placeholders for the action buttons ('Play Again', 'Main Menu').

tickets.title: Create ResultAnimation (Lottie) Component
tickets.description: Create a component to display a Lottie animation. It should be able to load different animation files based on the game's outcome (win, draw, lose).
dependencies: Integrate Game Over Logic with Modal
acceptance_criteria: The component successfully wraps `lottie-react-native`.
It displays a 'win' animation (e.g., confetti) if the player wins.
It displays a different, neutral or sad, animation for a draw or loss.
The animation auto-plays once when the modal appears.

tickets.title: Add 'Play Again' and 'Main Menu' Functionality
tickets.description: Implement the logic for the 'Play Again' and 'Main Menu' buttons inside the `GameOverModal` using the reusable `PrimaryButton` component.
dependencies: Integrate Game Over Logic with Modal
acceptance_criteria: Tapping 'Play Again' closes the modal and resets the game board state for a new game.
Tapping 'Main Menu' closes the modal and navigates the user back to the HomeScreen.
Buttons are styled correctly and provide user feedback on press.

tickets.title: Develop AI Opponent Logic
tickets.description: Create the algorithm for the AI opponent. Start with a simple strategy: 1) Win if possible, 2) Block opponent's win, 3) Make a random valid move.
acceptance_criteria: The AI function takes the current board state and returns the coordinates of its next move.
The AI will make a winning move if one is available.
The AI will block the player from winning on their next turn if a block is available.
If no winning or blocking move exists, the AI chooses a valid empty cell.

tickets.title: Integrate AI Player into Game Loop
tickets.description: In single-player mode ('vs-coach'), integrate the AI logic so that it automatically makes a move after the human player's turn.
acceptance_criteria: When the game mode is 'vs-coach', the app waits for the player's move.
After the player moves, the AI logic is triggered.
The board state is updated with the AI's move after a short, artificial delay (e.g., 500ms) to simulate thinking.
The turn switches back to the human player.

tickets.title: Implement AI Hint Logic
tickets.description: Develop the logic for the AI Coach's hint feature. The hint should identify the best possible move for the player (either a winning move or a blocking move).
acceptance_criteria: A function is created that analyzes the board and identifies the optimal move for the current player.
The hint is only generated in 'vs-coach' mode.
The hint is triggered after a period of player inactivity (e.g., 5 seconds).

tickets.title: Display AI Hints on the GameBoardCell
tickets.description: Implement the visual feedback for the AI hint on the `GameBoardCell` component, making the suggested cell glow or pulse as per the design spec.
acceptance_criteria: The `GameBoardCell` component accepts an `isHinted` prop.
When `isHinted` is true, the cell displays a glowing shadow effect.
The shadow's opacity animates in a loop to create a 'pulsing' effect.
The hint is removed after the player makes any move.
